thread.section_title: Democrat and Chronicle | Rochester news, community, entertainment, yellow pages and classifieds. Serving Rochester, New York | democratandchronicle.com
thread.title: Kids Calendar: Oct. 27 to Nov. 2

author: democratandchronicle.com
title: Kids Calendar: Oct. 27 to Nov. 2
text:
Tuesday Babies and Books: For babies and toddlers 24 months and younger, with an adult. 10:30 a.m. Oct. 27. Chili Public Library, 3333 Chili Ave., Chili. Free. (585) 889-2200 or www.chililibrary.org .
Babies and Books: Stories, songs, rhymes and more. For ages 2 and younger. 10:30 to 11:15 a.m. Oct. 27. Seymour Library, 161 East Ave., Brockport. (585) 637-1050 or www.seymourlibraryweb.org .
Gro-Moore Farms Fall Family Fun: Attractions (for families with children up to third grade) include the ABC’s of Agriculture Maze, No Left Turn Maze, Haunted House, The Fun House for Kids, a petting zoo, pumpkin slide and many fall scenes to enjoy. Special weekend activities run from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Saturdays and Sundays and include The John Deere Express Train Ride, Super Slide, Mini Golf, Tractor-drawn Wagon Rides, Duck Races, Tattoo Parlor, Pumpkin Painting, Trike Track, Straw Crawl for the little ones. 8 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. Monday through Friday; 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. Saturday and Sunday, through Oct. 31. Gro-Moore Farms, 2811 East Henrietta Road, Henrietta. Free; $10 per person for special weekend activities. (585) 359-3310 or www.gromoore.com .
Halloween Scavenger Hunt: Follow the clues in the library and make a related craft. For all ages. 11 a.m. to noon Oct. 27. Greece Public Library, 2 Vince Tofany Blvd., Greece. Free. (585) 225-8951 or www.greecelibrary.org .
Junior Friends: For ages 12-18. 6 p.m. Oct. 27. Chili Public Library, 3333 Chili Ave., Chili. (585) 889-2200 or www.chililibrary.org .
Makey Makey Mad Science: For children in grades 2-5. 6:30 to 7:30 p.m. Oct. 27. Registration required. Seymour Library, 161 East Ave., Brockport. Free. (585) 637-1050 or www.seymourlibraryweb.org .
Metro Council for Teen Potential 2015 Celebration of Youth: The program includes awards and entertainment. 3:45 to 5:15 p.m. Oct. 27. Asbury First United Methodist Church, 1050 East Ave. (585) 445-6774 or www.metrocouncilrochester.org .
Playing with Power: Celebrating 30 Years of the Nintendo Entertainment System: Explore the history of Nintendo and trace the evolution of its groundbreaking Nintendo Entertainment System (NES). Learn about Nintendo’s storied past as a producer of games, toys, and other playthings by viewing unique Nintendo-produced artifacts from The Strong’s collections. Oct. 24 to Jan. 24. The Strong, 1 Manhattan Square. Free with museum admission. (585) 263-2700 or www.museumofplay.org .
Preschool Activity Club: For ages 2-5, with their caregivers. 11:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. Oct. 27. Seymour Library, 161 East Ave., Brockport. (585) 637-1050 or www.seymourlibraryweb.org .
Read to Annie: Bring in or pick out your favorite story to read to Annie, our favorite shih-tzu. 5:30 p.m. Oct. 27. Registration required. Brighton Memorial Library, 2300 Elmwood Ave., Brighton. Free. (585) 784-5300 or www.brightonlibrary.org .
Sid the Science Kid: The Super-Duper Exhibit: Children can step into Sid’s world and become science kids themselves as they discover and investigate everyday science questions around Sid’s home, and at school-in the Super Fab Lab and on the playground. Through hands-on activities, kids use scientific tools and thinking to learn about simple machines, the laws of motion, magnetism, air power, and the five senses. Through Jan. 24. The Strong, 1 Manhattan Square. Free with museum admission. (585) 263-2700 or www.museumofplay.org .
Stories and More: For children of all ages with an adult. 9:45 to 10:15 a.m. Oct. 27. Greece Public Library, 2 Vince Tofany Blvd., Greece. Free. (585) 225-8951 or www.greecelibrary.org .
Teen Tuesday: For students in grades 9-12. 2:30 to 4 p.m. Oct. 27. Penfield Public Library, 1985 Baird Road, Penfield. Free. (585) 340-8720 or www.penfieldlibrary.org .
Teen Volunteer Night: Volunteer to help your community and earn service hours. For ages 12-18. 7 to 8 p.m. Oct. 27. Registration required. Greece Public Library, 2 Vince Tofany Blvd., Greece. (585) 225-8951 or www.greecelibrary.org .
Wee Read: Baby and Toddler Story Time: For ages 3 and younger, with a caregiver. 10 to 11 a.m. Tuesdays, through Dec. 1. Children’s Center. Central Library of Rochester and Monroe County, 115 South Ave. Free. (585) 428-8150 or www.libraryweb.org .
Wednesday
Halloween Program for Kids: Costumes are encouraged, but not required. The children will listen to a story, make a craft, decorate a small pumpkin and parade through the library. For ages 4-9. 4 to 5 p.m. Oct. 28. Registration required. Greece Public Library, 2 Vince Tofany Blvd., Greece. (585) 225-8951 or www.greecelibrary.org .
Pajamarama Story Time: Come in pajamas with your favorite stuffed animal, doll, or blanket and enjoy stories before bedtime. For ages 6 and younger. 6:30 to 7 p.m. Oct. 28. Mendon Public Library, 22 N. Main St., Honeoye Falls. Free. (585) 624-6067 or www.mendonlibrary.org .
Reading, Rhythm and Rhyme: For ages 18 months through 3 with an adult. 10:30 to 11 a.m. Oct. 28. Greece Public Library, 2 Vince Tofany Blvd., Greece. (585) 225-8951 or www.greecelibrary.org .
Wii Wednesday: For students in grades K-5. Play games and have a snack. 4:30 to 6 p.m. Oct. 28. Livonia Public Library, 2 Washington St., Livonia. Free. (585) 346-3450 or www.livonialibrary.org .
Thursday
Building Buddies Club: Encourages creativity, fine motor skills, and parallel play for toddlers and young children. For ages 1-4. 10 to 11 a.m. Oct. 29. Mendon Public Library, 22 N. Main St., Honeoye Falls. Free. (585) 624-6067 or www.mendonlibrary.org .
Halloween Party: Trick-or-treating for the kids. For ages 10 and younger Please bring a donation of a non-perishable food item for the Greece Ecumenical Food Shelf. 5:30 to 6:15 p.m. (6:15 to 7 p.m. music with Bob Neusatz) Oct. 29. Registration required. GrandeVille Senior Living Community, 555 Maiden Lane, Greece. (585) 621-6160.
Introducing the Library: Skills for Homeschoolers: Tour the library, learn how to search the catalog and get an introduction to some of the database and print reference sources. For homeschool students in grades 6 and higher. 10:30 a.m. to noon Oct. 29. Registration required. Penfield Public Library, 1985 Baird Road, Penfield. Free. (585) 340-8720 or www.penfieldlibrary.org .
Lego Club: For ages 5-12. 6:30 to 7:30 p.m. Oct. 29. Registration required. Ogden Farmers’ Library, 269 Ogden Center Road, Ogden. (585) 617-6181 or www.ogdenlibrary.com .
Pajama Story Time: Wear your pajamas and bring a stuffed friend. For children of all ages with an adult. 7 p.m. Oct. 29. Chili Public Library, 3333 Chili Ave., Chili. (585) 889-2200 or www.chililibrary.org .
Preschool Story Time: For ages 2-5 with caregivers. 10:30 to 11 a.m. Oct. 29. Seymour Library, 161 East Ave., Brockport. (585) 637-1050 or www.seymourlibraryweb.org .
Simply Stories: For children of all ages with an adult. 10 a.m. Oct. 29. Chili Public Library, 3333 Chili Ave., Chili. (585) 889-2200 or www.chililibrary.org .
Toddler Time: For ages 18 to 36 months, with an adult. 10:30 a.m. Thursdays and Fridays. Victor Farmington Library, 15 W. Main St., Victor. (585) 924-2637 or www.victorfarmingtonlibrary.org .
Trick or Treating the Webster Public Library: Trick or treat stations, games, crafts, and snacks. Wear a costume. 6:30 to 8 p.m. Oct. 29. Webster Public Library, Webster Plaza, 980 Ridge Road, Webster. (585) 872-7075 or www.websterlibrary.org .
Friday
Babies Love Books: For ages 15 months and younger with an adult. 9:30 to 10 a.m. Oct. 30. Greece Public Library, 2 Vince Tofany Blvd., Greece. Free. (585) 225-8951 or www.greecelibrary.org .
Fright on Ice: Enjoy an evening of skating to Halloween music, videos. Children are encouraged to wear their costumes. Prizes will be given for the best costume, scariest costume and more. 6:30 to 8:30 p.m. Oct. 30. Bill Gray’s Regional Iceplex, Monroe Community College Campus, 2700 Brighton-Henrietta Townline Road, Brighton. $6 (rental skates are available for $4). (585) 424-4625.
Pumpkin Walk: Walk and look at pumpkins carved from around the community. Submit a pumpkin for the walk take $1 off admission. Fundraiser for RYH Bantam Select team. 7 to 9 p.m. Oct. 30. Bill Gray’s Regional Iceplex, Monroe Community College Campus, 2700 Brighton-Henrietta Townline Road, Brighton. $3; $2 for ages 9 and younger. (585) 247-4291.
Story Time: For toddlers to preschool. 10 to 10:30 a.m. Oct. 30. Mendon Public Library, 22 N. Main St., Honeoye Falls. Free. (585) 624-6067 or www.mendonlibrary.org .
Toddler Story Time: For ages 1-4. 10:30 a.m. Oct. 30. Lift Bridge Book Shop, 45 Main St., Brockport. Free. (585) 637-2260 or www.liftbridgebooks.com .
Toddler Time: For ages 18 to 36 months, with an adult. 10:30 a.m. Fridays. Victor Farmington Library, 15 W. Main St., Victor. (585) 924-2637 or www.victorfarmingtonlibrary.org .
Toddler Trick-or-Treat: Safe indoor trick-or-treating for preschoolers throughout the museum galleries. Come in costume, meet storybook favorites, Halloween music, games and activities. 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. Oct. 30. The Strong, 1 Manhattan Square. Free with museum admission. (585) 263-2700 or www.museumofplay.org .
Trick or Treat Around the Library: For children of all ages with their caregivers. 10 to 11:30 a.m. Oct. 30. Gates Public Library, 902 Elmgrove Road, Gates. (585) 247-6446 or www.gateslibrary.org .
Saturday
Build A Story: Use your imagination to design a fun or scary story. Open to grades 2-3. noon to 1 p.m. Oct. 31. Registration required. Seymour Library, 161 East Ave., Brockport. (585) 637-1050 or www.seymourlibraryweb.org .
CoderDojo ROC: A computer programming club. For ages 7-17. 10 to 11:30 a.m. Oct. 31. Registration required. Greece Public Library, 2 Vince Tofany Blvd., Greece. (585) 225-8951 or www.greecelibrary.org .
Electricity Theater: Featuring two custom-built, 6-foot Tesla coils modified to produce musical bolts of lightning. Noon, 2 and 4 p.m. Saturdays and Sundays. Rochester Museum & Science Center, 657 East Ave. Free with museum admission. (585) 271-1880, (585) 697-1942 or www.rmsc.org .
Gro-Moore Farms Fall Family Fun: Attractions (for families with children up to third grade) include the ABC’s of Agriculture Maze, No Left Turn Maze, Haunted House, The Fun House for Kids, a petting zoo, pumpkin slide and many fall scenes to enjoy. Special weekend activities run from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Saturdays and Sundays and include The John Deere Express Train Ride, Super Slide, Mini Golf, Tractor-drawn Wagon Rides, Duck Races, Tattoo Parlor, Pumpkin Painting, Trike Track, Straw Crawl for the little ones. 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. 31. Gro-Moore Farms, 2811 East Henrietta Road, Henrietta. Free; $10 per person for special weekend activities. (585) 359-3310 or www.gromoore.com .
Halloween Party for Kids: Crafts, games, snacks and a haunted house. Open to preschool through Grade 3. 1 to 3 p.m. Oct. 31. Seymour Library, 161 East Ave., Brockport. (585) 637-1050 or www.seymourlibraryweb.org .
My Planets: Show about our solar system for the youngest explorers For ages 3-5. 10 a.m. Oct. 31. Rochester Museum & Science Center’s Strasenburgh Planetarium, 657 East Ave. $7; $6 for seniors, college students with ID and ages 3-18; free to ages 2 and younger. (585) 271-1880 or www.rmsc.org .
Playing with Power: Celebrating 30 Years of the Nintendo Entertainment System: Explore the history of Nintendo and trace the evolution of its groundbreaking Nintendo Entertainment System (NES). Learn about Nintendo’s storied past as a producer of games, toys, and other playthings by viewing unique Nintendo-produced artifacts from The Strong’s collections. Oct. 24 to Jan. 24. The Strong, 1 Manhattan Square. Free with museum admission. (585) 263-2700 or www.museumofplay.org .
RMSC Players: Live Science Performances: Exciting science demonstrations. 1 to 3 p.m. Saturdays and Sundays. Rochester Museum & Science Center, 657 East Ave. Free with museum admission. (585) 271-1880 or www.rmsc.org .
Saturday Night Skies: A concise tour of the stars, constellations and planets in the current sky uses new solid-state lasers to guide you through the magnificent star field. For ages 5 to adult. 7:30 p.m. Oct. 31. Rochester Museum & Science Center’s Strasenburgh Planetarium, 657 East Ave. $7; $6 for seniors, college students with ID and ages 3-18; free to ages 2 and younger. (585) 271-1880 or www.rmsc.org .
Saturday Sun, Moon and Stars: Family star show presenting prominent constellations that take audiences on a quick trip to the moon. Star show for ages 5-8 accompanied by an adult. 11 a.m. Oct. 31. Rochester Museum & Science Center’s Strasenburgh Planetarium, 657 East Ave. $7; $6 seniors, college students with ID and ages 3-18; free to ages 2 and younger. (585) 271-1880 or www.rmsc.org .
Science Encounters: Balance a bicycle wheel in one hand, explore nano-science, or meet some of RMSC’s live animal friends. Hourly, 10:15 to 3:15 p.m. Saturdays and Sundays. Rochester Museum & Science Center, 657 East Ave. Free with museum admission. (585) 271-1880 or www.rmsc.org .
Sid the Science Kid: The Super-Duper Exhibit: Children can step into Sid’s world and become science kids themselves as they discover and investigate everyday science questions around Sid’s home, and at school-in the Super Fab Lab and on the playground. Through hands-on activities, kids use scientific tools and thinking to learn about simple machines, the laws of motion, magnetism, air power, and the five senses. Through Jan. 24. The Strong, 1 Manhattan Square. Free with museum admission. (585) 263-2700 or www.museumofplay.org .
Trick or Treat Around the Central Library: Decorate a treat bag in the Children’s Center, and then explore the whole library, finding a treat in each department. 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Oct. 31. Central Library of Rochester and Monroe County, 115 South Ave. (585) 428-8150 or www.libraryweb.org .
Trick-or-Treat on Main Street: Also a showing of Hotel Transylvania at the Geneseo Rivera at 1 p.m. and the Halloween parade at 6:30 p.m. 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. Oct. 31. Main Street, Geneseo. Free; $5 for movie.
Trunk or Treat: Features vehicles that are decorated and trunks filled with candy to hand out. Donuts and cider will also be provided. For ages 12 and younger. (rain or shine). 5 to 7 p.m. Oct. 31. New Covenant Fellowship Church, 1350 Five Mile Line Road at Plank Road, Penfield. Free. (585) 216-1350 or www.abovegroundchurch.com .
ZooBoo: Halloween event and fundraiser presented by Walmart, featuring trick-or-treating, educational activities and family photo opportunities. 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. Saturdays and Sundays, through Oct. 31. Seneca Park Zoo, 2222 St. Paul St. $8.50 plus zoo admission. (585) 336-7200 or www.senecaparkzoo.org .
Sunday
Old-School Dungeons & Dragons Gaming Group: All ages and levels are welcome. 12:15 to 4 p.m. Nov. 1. Lift Bridge Book Shop, 45 Main St., Brockport. Free. (585) 637-2260 or www.liftbridgebooks.com .
Playing with Power: Celebrating 30 Years of the Nintendo Entertainment System: Explore the history of Nintendo and trace the evolution of its groundbreaking Nintendo Entertainment System (NES). Learn about Nintendo’s storied past as a producer of games, toys, and other playthings by viewing unique Nintendo-produced artifacts from The Strong’s collections. Oct. 24 to Jan. 24. The Strong, 1 Manhattan Square. Free with museum admission. (585) 263-2700 or www.museumofplay.org .
Sid the Science Kid: The Super-Duper Exhibit: Children can step into Sid’s world and become science kids themselves as they discover and investigate everyday science questions around Sid’s home, and at school-in the Super Fab Lab and on the playground. Through hands-on activities, kids use scientific tools and thinking to learn about simple machines, the laws of motion, magnetism, air power, and the five senses. Through Jan. 24. The Strong, 1 Manhattan Square. Free with museum admission. (585) 263-2700 or www.museumofplay.org .
Monday
American Girl Club: Felicity Learns a Lesson . For ages 5-12. 4 p.m. Nov. 2. Chili Public Library, 3333 Chili Ave., Chili. (585) 889-2200 or www.chililibrary.org .
Baby Story Time: For ages 2 and younger with a caregiver. 10 a.m. Nov. 2. Gates Public Library, 902 Elmgrove Road, Gates. (585) 247-6446 or www.gateslibrary.org .
Chess Club: For all ability levels. Open to ages 18 and younger. 6 to 8 p.m. Nov. 2. Chili Public Library, 3333 Chili Ave., Chili. (585) 889-2200 or www.chililibrary.org .
Learn to Knit: Learn to knit and contribute to the mitten tree. In Part 1, learn how to cast on and the basic knitting stitch. Students should attend both classes, and bring knitting needles (size 8-10) and a skein of worsted weight yarn (not “Homespun” brand). 6:30 to 8 p.m. Nov. 2 and 16. Registration required. Greece Public Library, 2 Vince Tofany Blvd., Greece. (585) 225-8951 or www.greecelibrary.org .
Melody Kids: For ages 6 months to 4 years. Children must be accompanied by an adult. 10 to 10:45 a.m. Mondays; Nov. 2 through Nov. 30. Registration required. Gates Community Center, 1605 Buffalo Road, Gates. $26. (585) 247-6100, ext. 235, or www.gatesrecparks.org .
Monday Kicks: Activities are designed for 2-6. 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. Nov. 2. The Strong, 1 Manhattan Square. $9 per student. (585) 263-2700 or www.TheStrong.org .
Mother Goose Time: For ages 18 months and younger, accompanied by parent or caregiver. 10:30 to 11:30 a.m. Mondays. Victor Farmington Library, 15 W. Main St., Victor. (585) 924-2637 or www.victorfarmingtonlibrary.org .
Story Time Stars: This class is designed to support early literacy skills in children, as well as encourage them to love books at an early age. 10:15 to 10:45 a.m. Nov. 2. Greece Public Library, 2 Vince Tofany Blvd., Greece. Free. (585) 225-8951 or www.greecelibrary.org .
Story Time with Mary Jo: For ages 2-5 with a caregiver. 10:15 to 11 a.m. Nov. 2. Gates Public Library, 902 Elmgrove Road, Gates. (585) 247-6446 or www.gateslibrary.org .
Toddler Story Time: For ages 15 months to 3, with an adult. 9:30 to 10 a.m. Nov. 2. Greece Public Library, 2 Vince Tofany Blvd., Greece. Free. (585) 225-8951 or www.greecelibrary.org .
Toddler Story Time: Stories, songs and finger plays for children 18 months- to 3-years old, with caregiver. 9:15 a.m., 10 a. m. and 10:45 a.m. Mondays, Nov. 2 to 16. Pittsford Community Library, 24 State St., Pittsford. Free. (585) 248-6275 or www.townofpittsford.org/library .
Toddler Time: For ages 2-3 with an adult. 10 a.m. Nov. 2. Chili Public Library, 3333 Chili Ave., Chili. (585) 889-2200 or www.chililibrary.org .
Toddler Time: For ages 2-3 with a caregiver. 10:30 to 11 a.m. Nov. 2. Seymour Library, 161 East Ave., Brockport. (585) 637-1050 or www.seymourlibraryweb.org .
